@graph.rdfs:comment: For defining the level of learning or knowledge material or experience, such as educational or skill level
@graph.rdfs:label: Level

@graph.rdfs:comment: An adavanced level course compared to education level.
@graph.rdfs:label: Advanced

@graph.rdfs:comment: An Introductory level course compared to education level.
@graph.rdfs:label: Basic

@graph.rdfs:comment: For a given educational level. Basic is same as introductory.
@graph.rdfs:label: EducationalLevel

@graph.rdfs:comment: Different types of a permit to stay or live in a country issued by governments to a person
@graph.rdfs:label: Travel Permit

@graph.rdfs:comment: A permit issued in form of a permit to study in a foreign country that might come with a limited or full work permit
@graph.rdfs:label: Student-Permit

@graph.rdfs:comment: A permit issued in form of a permit to work in any industry for any employer in a foreign country without limitation on number of hours that can be worked
@graph.rdfs:label: Open Work-Permit Full-Time

@graph.rdfs:comment: A permit issued in form of a permit to work in any industry for any employer in a foreign country with limitation on number of hours that can be worked
@graph.rdfs:label: Open Work-Permit Part-Time

@graph.rdfs:comment: A permit issued in form of a permit to work with limitations on employers for which one can work for in a foreign country without limitation on number of hours that can be worked
@graph.rdfs:label: Close Work-Permit Full-Time

@graph.rdfs:comment: Citizenship issud to a peron when they are born in a country
@graph.rdfs:label: Birth Citizenship

@graph.rdfs:comment: Citizenship issud to a peron through other means than birth in a country
@graph.rdfs:label: Granted Citizenship

@graph.rdfs:comment: Assylum Status and Refugee status
@graph.rdfs:label: Assylum Status

@graph.rdfs:comment: A permit given to a person to live and work freely in a foreign country but is not citizenship
@graph.rdfs:label: Permanent Residence

@graph.rdfs:comment: status granted to individuals allowing them access to classified information or to restricted areas
@graph.rdfs:label: Travel Permit

@graph.rdfs:comment: No Security Clearance
@graph.rdfs:label: None

@graph.rdfs:comment: Lowest level of security clearance is given to this person for a limited access to classified documents and information within a country
@graph.rdfs:label: Lowest Level Of Security Clearance

@graph.rdfs:comment: Any higher level of security clearance than lowest one, that is given to this person for more access to classified documents and information within a country
@graph.rdfs:label: Higher Levels Of Security Clearance

@graph.rdfs:comment: Formats that a Learning resource can be presented in those
@graph.rdfs:label: Learning Resource Type

@graph.rdfs:comment: Presentation and instructor-led course
@graph.rdfs:label: Presentation

@graph.rdfs:comment: Self-study course
@graph.rdfs:label: Self-Study

@graph.rdfs:comment: Research-based and lab course
@graph.rdfs:label: Research

@graph.rdfs:comment: Practical lab or internship based course
@graph.rdfs:label: Work-Centric

@graph.rdfs:comment: A Resume.
@graph.rdfs:label: Resume

@graph.rdfs:comment: Owner of this resume
@graph.rdfs:label: owner

@graph.rdfs:comment: Any state relevant to the health of an organism, including diseases and positive conditions.
@graph.rdfs:label: healthCondition

@graph.rdfs:comment: Different types of a award that can be given to a person or organization
@graph.rdfs:label: Award Type

@graph.rdfs:comment: A monetary award
@graph.rdfs:label: Monetary

@graph.rdfs:comment: A non-monetary award
@graph.rdfs:label: Non-Monetary

@graph.rdfs:comment: Any award. An award is something given to a person or a group of people to recognize excellence in a certain field; a certificate of excellence, for example trophies, titles, medals, badges, etc.
@graph.rdfs:label: Award

@graph.rdfs:comment: Award(s) given to the person (or a group of people) to recognize their merit or excellence.
@graph.rdfs:label: award
title
@graph.rdfs:comment: published title of a work, such as a newspaper article, a literary work, a website, or a performance work

@graph.rdfs:label: awardedDate
@graph.rdfs:comment: date the award was or is planned to be won.

@graph.rdfs:label: togetherWith
@graph.rdfs:comment: qualifier to specify the item that this property is shared with.

@graph.rdfs:label: assesses
@graph.rdfs:comment: The item being described is intended to assess the competency or learning outcome defined by the referenced term.

@graph.rdfs:label: partOf
@graph.rdfs:comment: object of which the subject is a part (if this subject is already part of object A which is a part of object B, then please only make the subject part of object A).

@graph.rdfs:label: conferredby
@graph.rdfs:comment: person or organization who awards a prize to or bestows an honor upon a recipient or that confers a degree

@graph.rdfs:label: forWork
@graph.rdfs:comment: qualifier of award received (P166) to specify the work that an award was given to the creator for

@graph.rdfs:label: classOfAward
@graph.rdfs:comment: class of award (order, medal etc.)

@graph.rdfs:label: awardRationale
@graph.rdfs:comment: qualifier to add short citation explaining the official reason for awarding a prize to a winner by the person or organization who gives the award. Do not use this property to annotate or add comments about a person's award. No quote marked needed.

@graph.rdfs:label: nativeLabel
@graph.rdfs:comment: label for item in its official or original language

@graph.rdfs:label: location
@graph.rdfs:comment: location of the object, structure or event.
Permits that make the person or organization eligible to work in different cuntries
@graph.rdfs:label: eligibililtyToWork

@graph.rdfs:comment: Elignility to work in a country
@graph.rdfs:label: WorkEligibility
securityClearance
@graph.rdfs:comment: Security clearance that the person or organization holds.

@graph.rdfs:label: throughPermit
@graph.rdfs:comment: an identity document issued by a government or international treaty organization.
All terms that will be used in the resume and person
@graph.rdfs:label: Terms
relatedTo
@graph.rdfs:comment: All terms that will be used in the resume and person
